sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; import styled from "styled-components"; import { NavLink as RouterNavLink } from "react-router-dom"; import Helmet from 'react-helmet'; import { CardContent, ClickAwayListener, Fab, Fade, Grid, Link, Breadcrumbs as MuiBreadcrumbs, Button as MuiButton, Card as MuiCard, Divider as MuiDivider, IconButton as MuiIconButton, Paper as MuiPaper, Tooltip, Typography, Zoom } from "@material-ui/core"; import { Add as AddIcon, Delete as DeleteIcon } from "@material-ui/icons"; import { spacing } from "@material-ui/system"; const NavLink = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => ( )); const Card = styled(MuiCard)(spacing); const Divider = styled(MuiDivider)(spacing); const Breadcrumbs = styled(MuiBreadcrumbs)(spacing); const Paper = styled(MuiPaper)(spacing); const IconButton = styled(MuiIconButton)(spacing); const Button = styled(MuiButton)(spacing); function SimpleTooltips() { return ( Simple Tooltips Tooltips display informative text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element. ); } function PositionedTooltips() { return ( Positioned Tooltips The Tooltip has 12 placements choice. They donâ€™t have directional arrows; instead, they rely on motion emanating from the source to convey direction.

); } class TriggersTooltips extends React.Component { state = { open: false }; handleTooltipClose = () => { this.setState({ open: false }); }; handleTooltipOpen = () => { this.setState({ open: true }); }; render() { return ( Triggerable Tooltips You can define the types of events that cause a tooltip to show.
); } } function TransitionsTooltips() { return ( Simple Tooltips Tooltips display informative text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element. ); } function Tooltips() { return ( Tooltips Dashboard Components Tooltips ); } export default Tooltips;
